meanings.definition: To catch fire or cause to catch fire and burn.
meanings.sent1: The dry leaves were combusting in the bonfire.
meanings.sent2: The old building was combusting due to an electrical fault.
meanings.sent3: The marshmallows were combusting so quickly, it was like a race to roast them.
meanings.sent4: His anger was combusting inside him, ready to explode at any moment.
meanings.sent5: The fireworks were combusting in a dazzling display of colors.

meanings.sent1: The combusting of the wood created warmth in the room.
meanings.sent2: The combusting of the paper caused a strong smell in the air.
meanings.sent3: The combusting of the candles made the room feel cozy and inviting.
meanings.sent4: The combusting of the engine filled the garage with smoke.
meanings.sent5: The combusting of the fireworks lit up the night sky with bright flashes.
